# Linear Model


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = total_crimes ~ avg_income, data = crime_summary)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-176.87  -67.39  -32.79   53.52  303.41 

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  6.327e+02  9.326e+01   6.784 1.77e-06 ***
avg_income  -5.108e-04  1.279e-03  -0.399    0.694    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 122.2 on 19 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.008328,	Adjusted R-squared:  -0.04386 
F-statistic: 0.1596 on 1 and 19 DF,  p-value: 0.694
```


:::
:::


Based on the above models, we need to be looking at the certain areas with crime data as the LAPD seems to be concentrated in the multiple districts in the Southwest. Try to adjust for bias.
